Package ohos.ivihardware.adas.model

Interface AdasSignalCallback

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AdasBooleanSubscribeCallback

    public interface AdasSignalCallback
    A callback class pertaining to subscribing to a specified ADAS signal.

    This class provides the following callback methods:

    • onChangeSignal: called when the VSA layer normally returns an ADAS signal value. This callback passes you the ADAS signal value.
    • onErrorSignal: called when the VSA layer fails to return an ADAS signal value. This callback passes you the signal ID and error code for you to determine how to handle the error.
    Since:
    3
    SystemCapability
    SystemCapability.Ivi.ADAS

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void onChangeSignal​(AdasPropertyInfo propInfo)
      Called when the VSA layer normally returns the specified ADAS signal value.
      void onErrorSignal​(java.lang.String propId, int errorCode)
      Called when the VSA layer fails to return the specified ADAS signal value.

    • Method Detail

      • onChangeSignal

        void onChangeSignal​(AdasPropertyInfo propInfo)
        Called when the VSA layer normally returns the specified ADAS signal value.

        This callback is invoked at the default interval of the specified ADAS signal value.

        Parameters:
        propInfo - Indicates ADAS signal information, including the ID, type, and value of the ADAS signal.
        Since:
        3

      • onErrorSignal

        void onErrorSignal​(java.lang.String propId,
                   int errorCode)
        Called when the VSA layer fails to return the specified ADAS signal value.

        If the VSA layer fails to return the ADAS signal value, this callback is invoked to pass you the signal ID and error code for you to determine how to handle the error.

        Parameters:
        propId - Identifies the ADAS signal.
        errorCode - Indicates the error code of the failure to return the signal value. The value can be INVALID_ARGUMENT_ERR for a parameter error or ZVSHW_MANAGER_ERR for other errors.
        Since:
        3
